comment: I originally wanted to be a criminal justice major but after taking his class and failing I changed my mine. No homework assignments, only 1 major paper, the midterm and final. That's all the assignments in class nothing else. Heavy on reading the textbook. All he did was read off of it and off the powerpoint. he was a funny professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Mr. Crowder's teaching style is quite appalling. He only had three assignments, two exams and a paper. For his exams, he required the class to read a book of which there was only one copy. It was in the library, and the mandate was that you had to read three chapters and take notes in two hours. 
He had a strict attendance policy as well, 8 AM btw.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: i have no clue how his rating is so high; lectures are not informative and there is a ridiculous amount of information to recall for his exams. only two exams and a paper; midterm was so insanely difficult that i withdrew from the class that same day. 70% of the test was from his own book which was basically an autobiography. pick another elective
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
only three grades. 
midterms, final and a 2500 word paper
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: crowder is very knowledgeable about criminal justice.however, you are only graded off of a midterm,paper,and final.all of your information comes out of two textbooks and videos for the midterm and final. he doesn't really tell you what is important to know for the test or any type of guide.only take him if you can memorize a whole textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Overall great professor. Attendence is not mandatory, but good luck getting a good grade if you skip class. Only problem is the fact that there are only three grades, so obviously there is less room for error and a lot of material covered on the exams. In my opinion, he makes the class interesting. Easily one of the best professors at KSU.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Stan is a great professor, I have nothing bad to say about him. This class was lecture/ book heavy, but the information is very interesting. As far as grades, we only had a midterm, paper, and final in this class so make sure you're paying attention and taking notes throughout the semester
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Lectures are given based on the textbook so get it and read it. Three graded assignments: a mid-term, paper, and final. Go to class and take good notes and you'll know every answer to the test. Homework outside of class was one video on Films On Demand every week. He is very passionate, knowledgeable, and willing to help with anything.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Crowder is not everyone's cup of tea, but he is respected by everyone - and for good reason. If you dispute your final grade, he will be fair and honest. Be ready to be a critical thinker and work hard for your grade. Attend every class and exams will be easy. Do. Not. Take. If. You. Skip. Classes. Try not to take the 3hr class at 8 am though.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I've taken Dr. Crowder for 4 classes. He the best professor I've ever had. I promise you will enjoy his classes very much. He wants you to put effort into your studies, so you will have to put in the work to get the grade you desire. There are two tests and a paper. Make sure you study hard and write your paper well. I highly recommend you take him
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Caring

comment: He is a good professor. We only had a midterm, paper and final he grades harsh on the paper. Overall great lectures, and documentaries. Attendance is mandatory, and it was overall a easy class. He does tell what info you need to know for the midterm and final. Takes attendance very seriously, if you don't go your grade will drop 1 or 2 letter grade
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: You will not find a better CRJU professor at KSU! Dr. Crowder is very engaging and funny during his lectures and I have taken two 8 am classes just to have him as a professor. Tests and grading criteria are straight forward. He is a tough, but not unfair, grader on papers because he wants the best from students. You won't regret taking him!
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Crowder is an amazing professor who cares for his students and will work with you as long as you work hard and don't slack off. The material in this class in heavy, and there is only three assignments. Ultimately, he wants to prepare you for a career in the criminal justice field and is very easy to talk to.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Crowder is a cool professor but he is tough with his papers. His midterm and final answers should jump at you if you prepare for them but even then, it can be a little difficult. even though it is a 7 week class, I wouldn't take him again only because he have 2 exams and a paper. Had a B in the class, got a C on the paper. ended up with a D overall
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Crowder is really passionate about what he does and thats obvious. He doesn't just teach you things for you to pass a test or write a paper on, he gives you information that will last a lifetime! Not to mention the guest speakers have been awesome. I already loved being a CJ major, but he really made it 10x better. Work hard, and ask questions!
rating_tags: Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: Crowder is a great professor who can really keep your attention throughout lectures. Regardless of how you feel about his teaching style though, he does provide some valuable perspective on what actually being in the CRJU is like and his experiences. The guest lectures are also interesting. I recommend all CRJU students take him at least once.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Okay professor, the tests are pretty straightforward / not too hard. Only thing that was extremely annoying to me was that he would go off on tangents TOO OFTEN. It got annoying and boring after not too long. There was a research paper and group project, but was not that bad. If you missed 8+ hours of class, you get dropped a letter grade.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I loved Dr. Crowder! His class was so interesting and he was so entertaining. He brings in a ton of guest speakers from the criminal justice field and his classes usually consist of  2 or 3 tests and a paper. That's all you get, but if you go to class and pay attention you'll be totally fine. Best professor I've had by far. Take his class!!
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: People told me to take Dr. Crowder so I did. It was the best decision! He is very caring, nice, and funny. He is there for you. His stories to lectures are great and he brings in guest speakers. Midterm, final, and a paper. His exams are based on his lecture on the book (easy).
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--Caring

comment: My favorite professor thus far! He's funny, caring and understanding! Always has the best stories and brings in guest speakers all of the time. Lectures consist of reading from the textbook, slides or stories about his grandkids. He turned a business major into a criminal justice major! If you don't leave this class with an A, something is wrong.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: DR CROWDER IS AMAZING. if i could take him for every class of my life i would. i have learned so much in all of his classes. he is so passionate about what he teaches, motivating, and will do anything to help his students succeed. He makes class so interesting and funny. easy A if u show up and GET THE TEXT BOOK and a highlighter!!!
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Crowder is the professor we'd all love to have! He's funny, gives great presentations, has many guest speakers come into the class and he's also a very easy grader!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Crowder is the best teacher I've ever had. He cares so much about the material that he is teaching and his students. Instead of just spitting out information, it feels like he is actually training his students for the criminal justice field. I have taken 5 classes from him. If you listen and do the work then you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Pretty easy class. He grades a bit harder than you would expect cause he is generally very laid back. If you highlight what he says in class and study that then you should ace the test (only 2)  Research project/paper is tough. Make sure you start working on it early. Overall easy A and fun class.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I loved this class! No, it is not all about serial killers BUT it is very interesting. It's a long course but he gives you a break. He gives really amazing lectures, he is passionate about what he teaches, and I paid attention the entire time. He is old fashioned, so no phones, but honestly you'll be fine without it for a few hours. Take this class
Great guy. Really cares about teaching. He literally wrote the book on ethics in CJ, so who better to teach it?

Top-notch professor! Makes you really work for an A on the 1 research paper requirement for all of his classes, but that should be expected. Tests are straightforward (no surprises). Very funny and makes his classes lively with great stories. Had 4 of his classes (+CRJU3312) and would gladly take him again if I weren't graduating this semester!

This was a 7 week course and it entailed a lot of material. Take at your own risk. Got an A in the class though. The class consists of guest lectures, powerpoints, videos, and book material. All of these things are on each exam. Midterm- 33%, Research Paper- 33%, and the Final- 33%. Have fun if you take him!  Attendance is mandatory!
really good teacher that obviously loves and cares about what he teaches.

Took Dr. Crowder for the week long class in August. He truly cares about his students, and recognizes students who have taken him in the past all the time. Was always around after class to answer any questions. Had one paper for this class and made an A on it. I recommend all CJ majors take him at least once.

He grades his papers SUPER hard. If you mess up one sentence he drops it from an A to a C.... kind of intense. I have always made A's on papers, I am a senior now and I did very well on his tests and then the 33% grade of the paper screwed me in the end. Would not take his class again.

He cares about his students success. He can be crass, but never to intentionally hurt a student's feelings. The layout is the same for all classes 1 Midterm, 1 research paper and 1 Final. My first Crowder class I was not a "Crowderite" but he didn't treat me poorly because of it. I am on my fourth Crodwer class and proud to be a Crowderite.

Crowder's class was exactly what I was looking for in PoSO. I was originally in Dr. Scherer's class and that was NOT at all what I was expecting that was more like another Criminology class.  This class is real world experience which is what Dr. Crowder always delivers.  He cares about his students and wants you to learn. Take him for all you can.

Although the class is not difficult and he can be very entertaining , crowder shows extreme favoritism towards his groupies and close mind. Though it is common for entertainers and writers it seems he gets off on building his own ego rather than teaching. I guess he wouldn't do quiet as well with mature minds that can think for their selves.

Dr. Crowder is country to say the least but he is very entertaining. He is ALL ABOUT THE STUDENT. The BOOK is REQUIRED. All tests come from the book and power points. He is extremely fair and all about student. One midterm, One Final and Paper. Definitely put a lot of energy into your paper. He expects good writers. I am definitley a "CROWEDERRITE"

I will be a "CROWDERITE" for life!  Dr Crowder is not one of the easiest, but you will learn so much from him if you desire to be in Law Enforcement!  His stories will make you laugh, and he will always always have your back unless you screwup!  He's the reason the CJ Dept is so great at KSU!

As an official "Crowderite", this class was awesome. I took it as a Minimester and absolutely loved it. He gives you adequate breaks, mixes up the material with movies, book reading, and powerpoints, and keeps you entertained even for 8 straight hours. I absolutely love Crowder! Take him if you can. You'll soon become a "Crowderite", too!

If you are not a criminal justice major, I would be wary of taking his class because he shows extreme favoritism towards his "crowderites". He can be extremely rude to non CJ majors in his class comments. He is very closed minded. I got a "B" in his class but it probably would have been an "A" if I was a CJ major.
Crowder is a great professor, very helpful. He explains everything exactly how he wants it done. It was an easy A for me.
He is the best professor KSU has to offer. He makes the material interesting, is funny, and eager to help you out. I plan on taking him for every class I can. Take Crowder.

I am a Crowderite for life! This man is amazing and really knows his stuff. All law enforcement should be required to take his classes. If they did all crimes would be solved quickly. I will definitely take his classes again. It is a lot of work to do the threshold assessment but after doing it I realized that I have learned so much. Two thumbs up!

GREATEST CLASS EVER! HE MAKES IT SO INTERESTING AND HAS GREAT DISCUSSIONS!!! MAKES ME WANT TO BE A CJ MAJOR TO BAD ITS NOT MY THING!! TEST ARE STRAIGHT FORWARD AND FROM THE NOTES DIRECTLY FROM THE BOOK! FINAL WAS THE SAME THING! THE PAPER WAS EASY AS PIE AS LONG AS YOU GET ENOUGH SOURCES AND ACTUALLY TAKE PRIDE IN THE WORK YOU PRESENT HIM- EASY A!!

One of the best professors at KSU. Very knowledgeable of the subject, provides real-world examples, and cares about his students. You will only have two tests and a paper. Everything he wants in the paper is in the syllabus, so he is crystal clear about what he is looking for.

He's a nice guy but he needs to remember that he is not a grammar professor and he actually does not know his english grammar. This was the only class i made a C in and gave me C's on my papers. He made corrections where they were not even close to necessary. He does not know much about the admission for the justice system as he claims.

Dr. Crowder is the best teacher we have. Honored to be a crowderite.  He cares a great deal for his students and he is extremely passionate about what he teaches. The paper is as hard as you make it, ask questions and use the resources available to you and you'll be fine.

Great teacher, does grade papers hard but go to the writing center and you will be okay.  Gives lots of insights and personal stories to relate to class as well as brings in guest speakers. Makes the class interesting and is all about helping us out. Very approachable and will work with you.

One of the best professors at KSU. I got a B because he grades his essays super hard. I would write the essay get him to look over it first and ask him if there is anything more you need to include and what he thinks about the paper. Hes a hard grader on papers. The tests are not hard. Just highlight everything he tells you too and you will be fine

The tests aren't that bad just make sure you have a highlighter and make sure you study everything higlighted but he grades papers extremely tough. He's funny but he was not clear about what he's looking for on the paper we had to write. Overall pretty good teacher but just be careful and make sure you have someone proofread your paper.

Avoid like the plague. He taught a cross over class with the honors department and he repeatedly changed the class times, he rarely replied to emails and when he did his response was the bare minimum he could muster, and then he goes and assigns an incomplete to EVERYONES grade just because he didnt want to grade before 17th when due on 12th.

Dr. Crowder is a really nice southern guy that REALLY knows his stuff! He cares about his subject matter and most importantly, he cares about his students! TAKE HIM! Pay attention to his lectures and read his highlighted material from the book, and you will do fine. He will make you want to take more CJ classes!
YOU WILL NEVER FIND A BETTER PROFESSOR THAN DR. CROWDER, THAT IS A PROMISE.  KSU IS LUCKY TO HAVE SOMEONE LIKE HIM !  YOU ARE CRAZY IF YOU DON'T ADORE HIS TEACHING STYLE

KSU is honored to have such an amazing professor.  Dr. Crowder sincerely cares about all of his students.  Make sure you attend all classes, highlight what he says, study whatever he repeats several times in class, and you'll do fine on the exams.

This was the best use of vacation time from work I ever spent. The class met for 8 hrs Mon-Fri, write a paper, no exams, and then it's over! Can seem a little like a career fair by the end of the week, but it helped me decide where in the CJ world I am best fitted for. I would recommend this class to anyone that might be going into the CJ field.

Excellent teacher who is as passionate about the material as he is his student's sucess. He works hard to get classes started he thinks will be relevant to the real world. I appreacate and love this proffessors energy and excitement about learning.

I LOVED his class! I would recommend taking his class.  Study the highlighted sections & power points and you'll do fine when it comes test time.  Be prepared, the classes are 8 hrs long, but you take breaks on a regular basis. He loves his students, the topics & it shows.

Dr. Crowder is by far the best professor I have ever had! I am not a CJ Major and if I had him earlier I probably would have switched. He genuinely cares about the students and the CJ field. He wants everyone to succeed and make the CJ field better. He is so passionate about his teaching that it is contagious! Take him! You will be glad you did!

I have taken every class Dr. Crowder teaches, and if he taught more I would take them as well! He is amazing and will do just about everything to help his students! If you tell him something in private, you can expect it to stay that way! KSU is honored to have such a wonderful prof.Go to WC for papers, study for tests and you will get an A!!!

Just an excellent teacher. If your intersted in a teacher that's concerned about the learning of his students, he's the one to take. I would take one of his classes just for the learning experience. If your not a CJ major, you would want to be by the time your finish with his class.
Great teacher, big ego, very sensitive. But great teacher!

AMAZING class, and AMAZING professor. 1 week long, 8 hours a day, but ya get 1 big break and several little ones. Reps from several different agencies (ie. FBI, DEA, etc.) came to speak and it was a great opportunity to learn about the agencies! Dr. Crowder really does care about his students, and makes class as painless as possible. I highly recc.
He is one of the mose interesting and knowledgable professors I have ever had.  I gained so much knowledge from his classes.

Awesome professor! He brings a lot experience to the class he really knows his subject.  As long as you do what you are supposed to it is an awesome class! In fact I am taking another one of his classes this semester!

Great professor, makes the class very entertaining.  This class was 4 hours long, but I went to every class and did not get bored.  You can get an A, you just have to go to class, and don't underestimate him.  Would recommend to anyone!

Dr. Crowder is a wonderful professor. I wish he taught every subject that way I could just take his classes everytime. You will never fall alseep in his class. He is very interesting, knowledgeable, kind, the list goes on....! You won't regret taking his classes.
Can there be a better professor on the KSU campus? I THINK NOT!

This class is very exciting even though it fell on a Sunday.  Dr. Crowder is very concise with everything he does.  Pay attention, go to class and follow directions and its a very easy class.  He is very easy going.

I really enjoyed this class even though it fell on a Sunday!  Dr. Crowder is a very intelligent and engaging professor who shows genuine concern for his students.  The information presented was enhanced with films and a guest speaker.  I attended every class and earned an A in the class.  There were a few tests and a paper (threat assessment).
Today was our final exam...don't have my grade on that yet, but an A thus far...this is the professor that makes you actually want to go to college.
No other professor at KSU can touch him. He is top notch and if you are good at writing simple/concise research papers you can count on an A. I have had him for three classes - an A in each one!
Had him for "profiling the violent employee" and "Serial offenders" one of the best open to debate will acknowledge when he's wrong I'd take another class with him teaching in a heartbeat.
Very interesting. You have to study but he gives good notes and handouts.
Very helpful. Tests are very detailed. Study your handouts and the book. Fantastic lecture good films. Excellent professor!
No Comments
